Posts.Content: Not sure how the friend thing works but will have a look.  I have started several things today and not finished them! Got the hoover out but then had acid reflux and now struggling a bit with indigestion.  I think you are right - need to take it easy and leave everything strenuous for a few weeks. I am going to The Christie Hospital and feel very safe there as soon as I walk through the doors.  Everyone seems to know what they are doing and that gives me confidence and security I guess. We're not far from you - we are in Cheshire, but my Oncologists works out of The Christie so we have about an hours journey, which I am actually getting used to now. Going to check out the friends link.
Posts.Title: Myocet / Cyclo Chemotherapy Regimen

Posts.Content: Hi Gillie Thanks for responding so quickly.  Can I add you as a friend so we can compare symptoms?! I had chemotherapy 7 years ago but things have changes a lot since then. Last time I suffered from fatigue and nausea, however they did manage to treat the nausea after the first few treatments but the fatigue did seem to build up over the course of the 6 sessions - I am told things may be different this time with new medications etc. I don't feel too bad today, a little tired but I had a restless night and have, like you, just taken Emend. I do feel slightly confused (again that I think is a side effect I have read about!) about all the various drugs etc but as you say, I am trying to use natural remedies to try to minimise the side effects (fruit toast, figs and green tea for breakfast). I dont have any Dexamethasone tablets but I seem to recall they put it in the drip yesterday, along with an anti-sickness too. Which hospital are you being treated at? I guess they all do things slightly differently. Keep in touch. Jude x

Posts.Content: Hi, My Doc told me to try Daktarin oral gel (miconazole) and it worked for me.  Maybe ask your doctor or pharmacist first, but you can get it without prescription.  Not heard of pineapple before, but it would probably be preferable if it works for you. All the best Judith
